definitions: statement expressing excessive pride in one's achievements or abilities
person who habitually boasts about their accomplishments
examples: His constant brag about his salary annoyed his colleagues
She couldn't resist a brag about her promotion
The neighborhood brag always exaggerated his fishing stories
Nobody liked the office brag who claimed every success

definitions: act of speaking with excessive pride about one's achievements or possessions
examples: His bragging about his new car became tiresome quickly
The team's bragging stopped after they lost the championship

definitions: member of the highest Hindu caste traditionally consisting of priests and scholars
absolute reality or universal spirit in Hindu philosophy
examples: The brahman performed the sacred rituals at the temple
Many brahmans served as advisors to ancient Indian kings
Understanding brahman requires deep meditation and spiritual practice
The concept of brahman underlies all Hindu philosophical thought

definitions: member of the highest priestly caste in Hinduism
member of a social or cultural elite, especially intellectual aristocracy
examples: The brahmin blessed the newlyweds during the ceremony
Local brahmins maintained the ancient temple traditions
Boston brahmins dominated the city's cultural institutions for generations
The literary brahmins rarely accepted outsiders into their circle

definitions: hairstyle created by interweaving three or more strands of hair
narrow ornamental trimming made by interweaving threads or strips
examples: She wore her hair in a single braid down her back
The children learned to make friendship braids at camp
Gold braid decorated the military officer's uniform shoulders
The curtains featured elegant braid along their edges

definitions: process of interweaving strands of hair into a patterned style
technique of interweaving materials to create decorative trim or rope
examples: She spent hours braiding her daughter's hair for the wedding
Professional braiding requires skilled hands and patience
The braiding of leather strips created durable horse reins
Traditional basket braiding involves complex weaving patterns

definitions: system of raised dots representing letters and numbers that blind people read by touch
examples: She learned braille after losing her sight in an accident
The library's braille collection helps visually impaired readers access literature

definitions: complex organ inside the skull that controls thought, memory, and body functions
intellectual capacity or mental ability of a person
person regarded as highly intelligent or the intellectual leader
examples: The human brain weighs approximately three pounds when fully developed
Doctors examined her brain for signs of injury
You need brains to solve this complex mathematical problem
He had the brains but lacked the motivation
She was the brain behind the successful marketing campaign
The team recruited several brains from top universities

definitions: bony structure of the skull that encloses and protects the brain
examples: The fossil's braincase revealed the dinosaur's brain size
Anthropologists measured the braincase to estimate cognitive capacity

definitions: original idea or invention regarded as the particular creation of someone
examples: The new app was the brainchild of two college students
This innovative design is her brainchild from years ago

definitions: exceptionally intelligent person, often with a focus on academic knowledge
examples: The young brainiac solved calculus problems for entertainment
Every team needs a brainiac to handle technical challenges

definitions: posterior part of the brain connecting to the spinal cord, controlling vital functions
examples: The brainstem regulates breathing and heart rate automatically
Damage to the brainstem can affect basic life functions

definitions: group discussion to produce ideas and solve problems creatively
sudden clever idea or moment of inspiration
examples: The team held a brainstorm to generate marketing strategies
Their weekly brainstorm produced several innovative solutions
She had a brainstorm about reorganizing the entire system
His midnight brainstorm solved the engineering problem

definitions: creative group activity where participants spontaneously contribute ideas to solve problems
examples: The brainstorming session lasted three hours but produced excellent results
Effective brainstorming requires an open and supportive environment

definitions: systematic effort to persuade someone to change their beliefs through psychological pressure
examples: The cult used brainwashing techniques to control its members
Political brainwashing involves repetitive propaganda and isolation

definitions: mechanical device used to slow or stop a moving vehicle or machine
something that slows down or stops an activity or process
examples: She pressed the brake pedal to avoid hitting the deer
The mechanic replaced both front brakes on the car
Rising interest rates act as a brake on economic growth
Environmental regulations serve as a brake on industrial expansion

definitions: railroad employee responsible for operating brakes on trains, especially historically
examples: The brakeman signaled the engineer to slow down
Old-time brakemen risked their lives jumping between cars

definitions: prickly shrub or vine, especially of the rose family including blackberries
examples: She scratched her arms picking berries from the bramble
The abandoned garden was overgrown with brambles and weeds

definitions: hard outer layers of cereal grain removed during milling, used in food and animal feed
examples: She added wheat bran to her morning cereal for fiber
The horses were fed a mixture of oats and bran

definitions: woody part growing from the trunk or main stem of a tree
local office or division of a larger organization or business
subdivision of a subject, field of study, or family lineage
examples: The storm broke several branches from the old oak tree
Birds built their nest on a sturdy branch
She manages the bank's downtown branch near the station
The company opened three new branches this year
Organic chemistry is a branch of chemical science
Their family branch emigrated to Australia in 1850

definitions: pattern or process of dividing into branches or subsidiary parts
development of branches from a main stem or structure
examples: The branching of blood vessels follows predictable patterns
Computer algorithms use branching to make decisions
The tree's branching created a perfect climbing structure
Coral branching provides habitat for marine life

definitions: name, design, or symbol identifying products of a particular company
mark burned on livestock or objects with a hot iron
particular type or kind of something
examples: Nike is a globally recognized brand in athletic wear
The company invested millions building their brand identity
Cowboys used brands to identify cattle ownership
The museum displayed antique branding irons
Her brand of humor doesn't appeal to everyone
He practices a unique brand of medicine

definitions: process of creating a unique name and image for a product or company
practice of marking livestock with a hot iron to indicate ownership
examples: Effective branding distinguishes products from their competitors
The startup hired experts to develop their branding strategy
Cattle branding takes place every spring on the ranch
Traditional branding methods are still used today

definitions: alcoholic spirit distilled from wine or fermented fruit juice
examples: He sipped cognac brandy after the formal dinner
The recipe calls for a tablespoon of cherry brandy

definitions: informal French restaurant serving simple meals and alcoholic drinks throughout the day
examples: The neighborhood brasserie serves excellent steak frites
They met for lunch at a casual brasserie

definitions: child who behaves badly or annoys others with poor behavior
examples: The spoiled brat threw a tantrum in the store
Don't be such a brat about sharing your toys

definitions: bold manner or show of boldness intended to impress or intimidate
examples: His bravado couldn't hide his fear of heights
The teenager's bravado vanished when confronted by authorities

definitions: warrior among certain North American indigenous peoples
examples: The brave defended his tribe against enemy attacks
Young braves underwent rigorous training and initiation rites

definitions: quality of showing courage and willingness to face danger or difficulty
examples: The firefighter received an award for bravery
Her bravery in speaking out inspired others to follow

definitions: exclamation shouted to express approval of a performance
examples: The audience shouted bravo after the soprano's aria
Bravos echoed through the concert hall

definitions: great technical skill and brilliance shown in a performance or activity
examples: The pianist's bravura impressed even seasoned critics
His bravura display of swordsmanship thrilled the audience

definitions: rough or noisy fight involving multiple people, typically in public
examples: A brawl erupted outside the bar after midnight
The hockey brawl resulted in several player ejections

definitions: person who frequently engages in rough or noisy fights
examples: The notorious brawler was banned from several establishments
Street brawlers often end up with criminal records

definitions: physical strength as opposed to intelligence
British dish of chopped and pressed pork formed into a loaf
examples: The job requires more brawn than brains
Athletes develop brawn through years of training
She served traditional brawn with pickles and bread
The butcher makes excellent homemade brawn

definitions: loud harsh cry of a donkey or similar sound
examples: The donkey's bray echoed across the farmyard
His laugh sounded like the bray of a mule

definitions: portable metal container for holding burning coals or charcoal
examples: They warmed their hands over the glowing brazier
The street vendor cooked chestnuts on a brazier

definitions: act of breaking or failing to observe a law, agreement, or code
gap in a wall, barrier, or defense made by breaking or force
examples: The data breach exposed millions of customer records
Her actions constituted a breach of contract
Enemy troops poured through the breach in the castle wall
Workers repaired the breach in the dam

definitions: food made from flour, water, and yeast mixed together and baked
money or means of earning a living
examples: She baked fresh bread every morning for breakfast
The bakery sells twelve varieties of artisan bread
He works hard to put bread on the table
Writing novels became her bread and butter

definitions: large round starchy fruit of a tropical tree, used as food when cooked
examples: Breadfruit is a staple food in many Pacific islands
The roasted breadfruit tasted similar to freshly baked bread

definitions: distance or measurement from side to side of something
wide range or extent of something
examples: The breadth of the river made crossing difficult
Measure the breadth before ordering new curtains
Her breadth of knowledge impressed the interview panel
The curriculum offers breadth rather than depth

definitions: person who earns money to support their family
examples: As the sole breadwinner, she worked two jobs
Traditional households had one breadwinner and one homemaker

definitions: interruption of continuity or uniformity; period of rest
instance of something being broken or damaged
opportunity or chance, especially one leading to professional success
examples: Let's take a coffee break before continuing
The students enjoyed their spring break vacation
The break in her arm required six weeks to heal
There was a break in the water main
Her big break came when a talent scout noticed her
This audition could be your break into showbusiness

definitions: broken articles or the amount of things broken
action of breaking something or fact of being broken
examples: The store policy doesn't cover breakage after purchase
Careful packaging minimizes breakage during shipping
Insurance covers breakage of expensive laboratory equipment
The breakage rate increased during the busy season

definitions: act of separating from a larger group or organization
play in sports where a player moves away from opponents toward goal
examples: The breakaway faction formed their own political party
Several states threatened breakaway from the union
The forward scored on a breakaway in overtime
The cyclist made a successful breakaway from the pack

definitions: mechanical failure or collapse of a system or relationship
detailed analysis or classification of information into categories
period of mental or emotional crisis resulting in inability to function
examples: The car breakdown left them stranded on the highway
Communication breakdown led to project failure
The report includes a breakdown of expenses by department
Here's a breakdown of the survey results
She suffered a breakdown after months of stress
His nervous breakdown required professional treatment

definitions: large ocean wave that breaks into foam on the shore
automatic switch that stops electrical current when overloaded
person or thing that breaks something
examples: Huge breakers crashed against the rocky coastline
Surfers waited for the perfect breaker
The circuit breaker tripped during the storm
Check the breaker box if you lose power
He worked as a professional safe breaker
The company hired a union breaker

definitions: first meal of the day, typically eaten in the morning
examples: She always eats a healthy breakfast before work
The hotel serves continental breakfast from seven to ten

definitions: action or process of separating into pieces or causing damage
act of failing to observe rules, laws, or agreements
examples: The breaking of the glass startled everyone
Wave breaking creates foam along the shore
Breaking traffic laws results in fines
The breaking of promises destroyed their friendship

definitions: forcible escape, especially from prison
sudden emergence or eruption, especially of skin condition or success
examples: The prison breakout involved three inmates
They planned the breakout for months
She suffered from teenage acne breakouts
The band's breakout album sold millions

definitions: sudden important discovery or development that removes a barrier to progress
examples: Scientists announced a major breakthrough in cancer research
The breakthrough came after years of failed experiments
